label: Advice to a specific age group
description: Direct advice framed for a specific life stage. Opens with 'My advice to [age] year olds:' or similar. States what you wish someone had told you.

label: Contrarian truth
description: Takes a widely accepted belief and states the opposite as fact, without apology. Not 'I think' — just states it.

label: Pattern from lived experience
description: Opens with an observation from personal experience or repeated observation: 'Everyone I know who X eventually Y.' Real pattern, stated plainly.

label: The thing nobody says
description: Exposes the gap between what's publicly said and what's privately true. 'Nobody tells you that...' energy without using that phrase directly.

label: Business / hiring conviction
description: A specific, tactical belief about building teams or companies. Often includes a specific type of person or situation with numbers.

label: What older people regret
description: Framed around what people at 60+ wish they'd done differently. Heavy on specificity about who those people are.

label: Modern trap / societal lie
description: Something modern culture sells as freedom or progress that is actually making people worse off. Named without moralising.

label: A specific tactic that sounds odd but works
description: One concrete, specific move that sounds counterintuitive but has clear logic. Often ends with a very precise detail that lands with slight humour.

label: Personal first-person conviction
description: Something the narrator personally did or believes — stated as lived experience, not general advice. 'I did X' or 'I believe X' without softening.

label: Relationship / marriage conviction
description: Honest, direct take on what makes long-term relationships work or fail. Specific over vague. What most people don't want to hear.

label: Money / wealth reframe
description: Takes a common belief about money and reframes it with a sharper observation. Often involves specific numbers to make it concrete.

label: Philosophical reframe of a modern problem
description: Takes a problem people struggle with today and applies a timeless lens. Named principle applied to a named modern situation.
